main_definition: A term used to describe a situation, action or quality that involves the eyes in some way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be caught by the eyes; visually noticeable or attractive.
meanings_and_examples.example: The painting was so eyed-catching that it drew crowds from all around.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A characteristic of an item that allows people to see its details, such as textures or colors.
meanings_and_examples.example: The fabric had a unique pattern that made the clothing items more eyed-appealing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To involve someone's eyes in some action; to engage visually.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the magic show, he used various tricks to keep everyone eyed on him throughout the performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reflecting light or having a sparkle as if one's eyes were shining.
meanings_and_examples.example: The diamond ring was so eyed that it seemed like the jewel itself had little stars in its center.
